verse.roman:
yathā yuvāṁ tri-lokasya
varadau parameṣṭhinau
tathā ma uttamaśloka
santu satyā mahāśiṣaḥ

synonyms: yathā—since; yuvām—both of you; tri-lokasya—of the three worlds; vara-dau—givers of benedictions; parame-ṣṭhinau—the supreme rulers; tathā—therefore; me—my; uttama-śloka—O Lord, who are praised with excellent verses; santu—may become; satyāḥ—fulfilled; mahā-āśiṣaḥ—great ambitions.
translation: You are both the supreme rulers and benedictors of the three worlds. Therefore, my Lord, Uttamaśloka, may my ambitions be fulfilled by Your grace.
